meanings.definition: The state of being seriously mentally ill; madness.
meanings.sent1: His insanity was evident from his wild and nonsensical behavior.
meanings.sent2: The asylum housed individuals struggling with severe insanity.
meanings.sent3: It was pure insanity to try skydiving without proper training.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of chaos, a storm of insanity.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of his insanity consumed him whole, leaving no trace of the person he once was.

meanings.sent1: The decision to invest all his money in a risky scheme was sheer insanity.
meanings.sent2: Her friends couldn't understand the insanity of her obsession with conspiracy theories.
meanings.sent3: It was an act of pure insanity to challenge the champion boxer to a match.
meanings.sent4: The market crash was a stark reminder of the financial insanity that can grip the world.
meanings.sent5: The insanity of his actions left everyone speechless, wondering what could drive a person to such folly.
